meanings.definition: A traditional saying expressing a common experience or observation.
meanings.sent1: Grandma always repeats the same adage about early birds and worms.
meanings.sent2: The adage 'practice makes perfect' is well-known.
meanings.sent3: The adage about cats having nine lives always makes me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In tough times, the adage 'when it rains, it pours' seems all too true.
meanings.sent5: The adage 'a penny saved is a penny earned' teaches us to be thrifty.

meanings.definition: A proverb or short statement expressing a general truth.
meanings.sent1: My favorite adage is 'actions speak louder than words'.
meanings.sent2: The adage 'honesty is the best policy' is timeless advice.
meanings.sent3: The adage 'too many cooks spoil the broth' is a reminder to keep things simple.
meanings.sent4: She lives by the adage 'never put off till tomorrow what you can do today'.
meanings.sent5: The adage 'look before you leap' is wise counsel for any situation.
